column4: hi I just installed Conky, which is cool, but it doesn't detect my CPU temp, any ideas how I can sort this?
any other conky users out there?
i guess you have to adjust ~/.conkyrc
well the rc file is just reading acpitemp, which I supppose must just be zero . . .
any ideas what I caould change it too . . . I'm on a toshiba laptop
no support for device type: thermal, but gives me tha battery charge
is that an old laptop? that maybe does not yet support thermal?
only a year old . . . i'm sure i can get temp in windows, but i can't remeber so long since i booted that partition ;)
maybe some needed module does not get modprobed by default..
I added the two modules lmsensors suggests after running sensor-detect . . . but no luck with them either . . .
try sudo modprobe thermal (it's a module i see is loaded here)
and now try the acpistuff (it's normal it doesn't return anything)
i think thermal was already loaded, i seem to remeber it in a probe listing from earlier
then i don't really know what's going on, sorry
ok no worries, thx for trying :)
